intro: Reseda sesamoides, commonly known as the common reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wastelands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Reseda sesamoides is also known for its historical use in dye production, as its flowers contain pigments used to create yellow and orange dyes.
